note.p: Army officer and colonial governor. Lieutenant, Royal Engineers, 1826; captain, 1841. Worked on the construction of the Rideau Canal in Canada, 1827–31. Lieutenant-governor of Van Diemen’s Land, 1846; governor-general, New South Wales, 1855. Governor of the Madras presidency, 1861–66. Chairman of the Royal Commission on pollution in British rivers, 1868–71. Knighted, 1856.
